snippet: Cuts from slicers and choppers accounted for 21,699 estimated visits to emergency rooms nationwide in 2011, according to the United States Consumer Product Safety Commission.
abstract: Injuries related to cooking utensils have gone up in last decade, according to United States Consumer Product Safety Commission, trend that some attribute to home cooks buying and using new kitchen products without knowing how to handle them properly.
lead_paragraph: Cuts from slicers and choppers accounted for 21,699 estimated visits to emergency rooms nationwide in 2011, according to the United States Consumer Product Safety Commission.

headline.seo: Cooking Tools Add Convenience, and Danger
